Rule.Original: call from complaint number(X),contact staff(X) => [OAPNP]immediate complaint acknowledgment(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. acknowledgeComplaintImmediately(X): Supplier acknowledges a complaint immediately. complaintInPerson(X): Customer raises a complaint in person. complaintByPhone(X): Customer raises a complaint by phone. acknowledgeComplaintWithin2WorkingDays(X): Supplier acknowledges a complaint within 2 working days. complaintByEmail(X): Customer raises a complaint by email. complaintByWebsite(X): Customer raises a complaint via the Supplier's website or another website endorsed by the Supplier for that purpose. complaintByPost(X): Customer raises a complaint by post. complaintByPhoneMessage(X): Customer raises a complaint by phone and a message is recorded without direct contact with a staff member of the Supplier.

complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. resolveOnFirstContact(X): Supplier resolves a complaint on first contact.

complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. processIdentifyAndManageUrgentComplaints(X): Supplier has a process for the identification and management of Urgent Complaints.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: A. ensuring relevant staff are aware of the potential remedies available to Resolve a Complaint;
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. ensureRelevantStaffAwareOfPotentialRemedies(X): Supplier ensures relevant staff are aware of the potential remedies available to Resolve a Complaint.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: B. tailoring any remedy offered to address the root cause of the Complaint and to address the individual circumstances of the Consumer or former Customer where these have been advised to the Supplier;

Rule.Original: complaint on topic(X),remedy for topic(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy(X)
customer advise special circumstance(X),remedy for special circumstance(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy special circumstance(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. proposeResolution(X): Supplier proposes a resolution to a complaint. addressRootCause(X): Supplier addresses the root cause of a complaint. addressIndividualCircumstances(X): Supplier addresses the individual circumstances of a customer. customerAdvisedIndividualCircumstances(X): Customer has advised the Supplier of their individual circumstances.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: C. where the Complaints are indicative of a wider problem or issue, addressing the root cause of the problem or issue; and

Rule.Original: complaint on topic(X),complaint topic indicative of general problem(X),remedy for general problem(X) => [OAPP]implement remedy for general problem(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. complaintIndicatesWiderProblem(X): Complaint indicates a wider problem or issue. addressRootCause(X): Supplier addresses the root cause of a problem or issue indicated by a complaint.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: D. resolving Billing errors in current Bills;

Rule.Original: billing complaint(X),billing error(X) => [OAPNP]fix error current billing period(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. billingError(X): Complaint is about a billing error. resolveBillingErrorInCurrentBill(X): Resolve billing error in current bill.

Rule.Original: complaint(X),-resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)
-customer satisfaction(X),investigated(X),resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. creditManagementAction(X): Supplier takes credit management action in relation to a specified disputed amount that is the subject of an unresolved Complaint. complaintBeingInvestigated(X): Complaint is being investigated by the Supplier, the TIO or a relevant recognised third party. complaintResolved(X): Complaint has been resolved to the satisfaction of the customer.

Rule.Original: complaint(X),notification sent less than 7 days(X),resolution(X) => [OM]-initiate legal proceedings(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. delayLegalProceedings(X): Supplier delays commencement of any legal proceedings while a Complaint is being handled internally and for 7 Working Days after a Consumer or former Customer is advised of the outcome of their Complaint. legalProceedings(X): Supplier is commencing legal proceedings against a Customer. complaintClosed(X): Supplier has closed a complaint.

Rule.Original: complaint(X), complaint acknowledgment(X) => [OAPNP]inform proposed resolution 15 days(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. proposeResolution(X): Supplier proposes a resolution to a complaint. informProposedResolutionWithin15WorkingDays(X): Supplier informs customer of proposed resolution to their complaint within 15 working days of receiving the complaint.

complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. urgent(X): Complaint is urgent. confirmProposedResolution(X): Supplier confirms proposed Resolution of a Complaint. implementProposedResolution(X): Supplier implements proposed Resolution of a Complaint. proposedResolutionAccepted(X): Customer accepts proposed Resolution of a Complaint. confirmProposedResolutionWithin2WorkingDays(X): Supplier confirms proposed Resolution of a Complaint within 2 Working Days after the date the Complaint is received. implementProposedResolutionWithin2WorkingDays(X): Supplier implements proposed Resolution of a Complaint within 2 Working Days after the date the Complaint is received.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: A. the reasons for the delay;
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. informDelayReason(X): Supplier informs Customer of the reason for delay in resolving a Complaint. urgent(X): Complaint is urgent. delay(X): Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint)

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: B. the specific timeframe for completion of the Resolution; and
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. informTimeframeForResolution(X): Supplier informs Customer of the specific timeframe for completion of the Resolution. cannotResolveIn15WorkingDays(X): Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days. urgent(X): Complaint is urgent. A complaint is urgent if it meets one of the following criteria: (a) it has been raised by a customer who has applied for or has been accepted as being in Financial Hardship under the Supplier's Financial Hardship policy and where the subject matter of the Complaint can reasonably be presumed to directly contribute to or aggravate the Financial Hardship of that Consumer; (b) it relates to a service that has been disconnected or is about to be disconnected and where due process has not been followed; or (c) it is a Complaint about a Priority Assistance service or Priority Assistance Customer. cannotResolveUrgentComplaintIn2WorkingDays(X): Supplier does not believe the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint can be Resolved within 2 Working Days.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: C. if the anticipated delay is a further 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer or former Customer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO;

Rule.Original: complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 25 days(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 2 days(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. delay10DaysOrMore(X): Supplier anticipates a delay of 10 Working Days or more in resolving a Complaint. informExternalDisputeResolution(X): Supplier informs customer of options for external dispute resolution. delayNotDueToMassServiceDisruption(X): Supplier anticipates a delay in resolving a Complaint that is not due to a declared mass service disruption.
informDelayPromisedTimeframe(X): Supplier informs customer of any delays to promised timeframes. delayPromisedTimeframe(X): There is a delay to a promised timeframe.

complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. provideMeansToMonitorProgress(X): Supplier provides a means for the Consumer or former Customer to monitor the Complaint's progress.

complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. investigated(X): Supplier has completed its investigation of a Complaint. informResolution(X): Supplier informs Customer of the Resolution of their Complaint. asSoonAsPracticable(X): Supplier takes action as soon as practicable.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xiii) completing all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Consumerâ€™s or former Customerâ€™s acceptance of that Resolution unless: A. otherwise agreed with the Consumer or former Customer; or B. the actions are contingent on actions by the Consumer or former Customer that have not been completed;

Rule.Original: agreed custom resolution date(X),complaint(X) => [OAPNP]resolve by custom date(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: resolutionAccepted(X): Customer has accepted a proposed resolution. resolution(X): Supplier has resolved a complaint. resolutionRequiresCustomerAction(X): Resolution requires action by the customer. resolutionWithin10Days(X): Supplier resolves a complaint within 10 working days of the customer's acceptance of the proposed resolution. customerAgreedToDelayedResolution(X): Customer has agreed to a delayed resolution.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xiv) only Closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or former Customer or if clauses 8.2.1(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with; and

Rule.Original: complaint(X),escalation(X),frivolous or vexatious(X),inform reasons not to proceed(X),no further assistance(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. closeComplaint(X): Supplier closes a complaint. consentCloseComplaint(X): Customer has given consent to close a complaint. complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. complaintResolved(X): Supplier has resolved a complaint. complaintAbandoned(X): Supplier has determined that a complaint has been abandoned. complaintNotActionable(X): Supplier has determined that a complaint is not actionable.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xv) where a Complaint is Closed with the consent of the Consumer or former Customer, at the Consumerâ€™s or former Customerâ€™s requests, providing a written confirmation of the Resolution of that Complaint to be sent the Consumer or former Customer within 5 Working Days.

Rule.Original: close case(X),complaint(X),customer consent close case(X),customer request confirmation of resolution(X) => [OAPNP]provide confirmation resolution 5 days(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. closedWithCustomerConsent(X): Complaint was closed with the consent of the Customer. customerRequestsWrittenConfirmation(X): Customer requests written confirmation of the Resolution of their Complaint. sendWrittenConfirmationWithin5WorkingDays(X): Send written confirmation of the Resolution of a Complaint to the Customer within 5 Working Days.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (b) Respond to dissatisfaction with timeframes: If a Consumer tells the Supplier that they are dissatisfied with the timeframes that apply to the management of a Complaint or seek to have a Complaint treated as an Urgent Complaint, the Supplier must tell the Consumer about the Supplier's internal prioritisation and internal escalation processes. If, after internal prioritisation and internal escalation the Consumer remains dissatisfied, the Supplier must tell the Consumer of the options for external dispute resolution, including the TIO.

Rule.Original: customer dissatisfied timeframe(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer dissatisfied timeframe(X),escalation(X),internal prioritisation(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: informInternalPrioritisationAndEscalationProcesses(X): Supplier informs customer of internal prioritisation and internal escalation processes. informExternalDisputeResolution(X): Supplier informs customer of options for external dispute resolution. complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. dissatisfiedWithTimeframes(X): Customer is dissatisfied with the timeframes that apply to the management of a Complaint or seeks to have a Complaint treated as an Urgent Complaint. dissatisfiedAfterInternalPrioritisationAndEscalation(X): Customer remains dissatisfied after internal prioritisation and internal escalation.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (c) Respond to dissatisfaction with progress or outcome: If a Consumer or former Customer tells the Supplier that they are dissatisfied with the progress or Resolution of a Complaint or asks about their options to pursue a Complaint further, the Supplier must tell them about: (i) the Supplier's internal escalation process; and (ii) the options for external dispute resolution including the TIO.

Rule.Original: customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied progress(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)
customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied resolution(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer. informInternalEscalationProcess(X): Supplier informs customer of internal escalation process. informExternalDisputeResolution(X): Supplier informs customer of options for external dispute resolution. dissatisfiedWithProgressOrResolution(X): Customer is dissatisfied with the progress or Resolution of a Complaint or asks about their options to pursue a Complaint further.
